com.klarna.checkout

Class KlarnaCheckout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.klarna.checkout.KlarnaCheckout

  • public final class KlarnaCheckout
extends java.lang.Object
    Primary checkout object for merchant integration.

    Standard "embedded" checkout initialization:
    KlarnaCheckout checkout = new KlarnaCheckout( myCurrentActivity );
    checkout.setSignalListener(..an implementation of the SignalListener interface..);
    checkout.loadCheckoutSnippet( ..the html snippet from merchant server.. );
    WebView webView = (WebView) checkout.getView();

    (the returned WebView can then be placed in layout placeholder or fragment as required)

    "Hybrid" checkout initialization:
    KlarnaCheckout checkout = new KlarnaCheckout( myCurrentActivity );
    checkout.setWebView( myMerchantWebView );
    checkout.setSignalListener(..an implementation of the SignalListener interface..);
    myMerchantWebView.loadUrl( "http://my_merchant_url" );

    ("myMerchantWebView" is a WebView instance that has loaded a web page which already contains the checkout code snippet)

    Disposal:
    When checkout is no longer needed you can call checkout's destroy method.

    checkout.destroy();

    NOTE: if using hybrid the main webView will not be destroyed. However the one created when using the embedded implementation will.

    See Also:
    SignalListener

      • setSnippet

        public void setSnippet(java.lang.String snippet)
        Startup option for use when using a snippet obtained from server Loads html checkout "snippet" received from server into main WebView.

        NOTE: This is not needed if a supplied webview is used.

        Parameters:
        snippet - the snippet of html code that initializes the checkout.

      • getView

        public View getView()
        Returns the currentcheckout view} instance
        Returns:
        instance of the main WebView being used by checkout. but it is cast down to view only.

      • setSignalListener

        public void setSignalListener(SignalListener checkoutSignalListener)
        Sets an instance of a CheckoutSignalListener for all signals to allow switched implementations.
        Parameters:
        checkoutSignalListener - an SignalListener implemented instance.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Method to destroy checkout and remove all resources. NOTE: the main WebView will only be destroyed if the checkout has created it. In hybrid mode the WebView will remain untouched.
